item.title: New episode of ‘The Coping with COVID’ podcast now available
item.description: In the latest episode of ‘The Coping with COVID’ podcast Dr Helen West is joined by a nursing student who has been redeployed to work in the NHS as part of the UK response to COVID-19.

item.title: The University of Liverpool Maths School set to open autumn 2020
item.description: Plans are in place to open the University of Liverpool Maths School (ULMaS) this autumn with the recruitment of teaching staff, a formal funding agreement approved and refurbishment of accommodation underway.

item.title: Effects of lockdown on our climate targets
item.description: With COVID-19 lockdown bringing about a reduction in carbon emissions, Professor Ric Williams, Chair in Ocean Sciences and APVC for Research & Impact for Science and Engineering, considers how this affects our progress towards climate targets:

item.title: Survey shines a spotlight on barriers to diversity in STEM
item.description: New research has highlighted some of the barriers faced by individuals from minority groups when it comes to pursuing a career in science.

item.title: Study identifies signs of acute pancreatitis not seen prior to COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: A new Liverpool study, published in Gastroenterology, identifies the signs of COVID-19 related pancreatitis which will enable earlier diagnosis and allow for swifter referral and management. As the global pandemic of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV2) persists, details of how the disease affects humans continue to emerge.

item.title: Gladstone Hall renaming
item.description: Gladstone Hall is part of the University of Liverpool’s Greenbank site which was demolished and recently rebuilt. Discussions between the University and its Guild of Students around naming this Hall have been in progress for some time.

item.title: Liverpool medical students graduate in virtual ceremony
item.description: The University of Liverpool’s School of Medicine Class of 2020 have graduated as junior doctors and received personal thanks for their efforts during the Covid-19 crisis from England’s Chief Medical Officer, Professor Chris Whitty.

item.title: Invasive rushes spreading in upland farm fields
item.description: A new study involving University of Liverpool ecologists shows invasive native species of rushes are spreading across UK upland farms and have the potential to threaten wildlife and the livelihoods of farmers.

item.title: Professor Tom Solomon launches Scouse Science coronavirus podcast
item.description: Award-winning science communicator, doctor and infectious diseases researcher Professor Tom Solomon is launching a new video podcast series looking at COVID-19 and its impact on science and society in Liverpool.

item.title: Study to explore experiences of end-of-life care during the COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: The University has launched a new study to gather information from bereaved relatives and health and social care professionals regarding end-of-life care during the COVID-19 pandemic,
